metadata.title: CVE-2022-48938 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:CDC-NCM: avoid overflow in sanity checkingA broken device may give an extreme offset like 0xFFF0and a reasonable length for a fragment. In the sanitycheck as formulated now, this will create an integeroverflow, defeating the sanity check. Both offsetand offset + len need to be checked in such a mannerthat no overflow can occur.And those quantities should be unsigned.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48938` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-261-generic - 4.4.0-261.295~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-261-generic - 4.4.0-261.295~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-261-lowlatency - 4.4.0-261.295~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1138-aws - 4.4.0-1138.144
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1183-azure - 4.15.0-1183.198~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-261.295~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1138.144').
